result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas G Zimdars was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
With huber and to commence within 60 days.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

1:15 pm
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan Agreement.
Court adjourned at 1:15 pm
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
FTP Hearing October 24, 2016, for $443.00

11:52 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with jail time, court costs and DNA sample and agrees not to charge BJ from another case.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-10 days county jail, with huber.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 12:00 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2016 at 11:30 am.

10:57 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - have an offer and need one more date.  Court sets for Plea and sentencing on June 7, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:58 a.m.
Status hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.

1:39 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat  - believes this case is being dismissed.  State moves to dismiss 2015CF81.  Court dismisses 2015CF81.  Court sets the 2015CM255 for Status Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:30 p.m.
Status hearing at 03-15-2016 01:30 pm

2:24 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets both cases for Status Hearing on March 15, 2016 at 1:30 p.M. 

Court adjourned at 2:26 p.m.

Court will set for Status Hearing on December 22, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.  If counsel appointed, defendant does not need to appear.

8:41 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court will set for Status Hearing on December 7, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.
